etymology.description: 囗(囗) (wéi, "enclosure") + 玉(玉) (yù, "jade") as phonetic = an enclosed area associated with valuables -> country
etymology.interpretation: 国(國) (guó, "country") combines the meaning of enclosure from 囗(囗) (wéi, "enclosure") with the pronunciation and cultural importance of 玉(玉) (yù, "jade"), emphasizing a protected, valuable territory.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by replacing 玉(玉) (yù, "jade") with 王(王) (wáng, "king") as a phonetic and visual simplification.

examples.chinese: 这个国家拥有悠久的历史(這個國家擁有悠久的歷史)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège guójiā yǒngyǒu yōujiǔ de lìshǐ.
examples.english: This country has a long history.

examples.chinese: 我们应该团结国民(我們應該團結國民)，共创辉煌(共創輝煌)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yīnggāi tuánjié guómín, gòng chuàng huīhuáng.
examples.english: We should unite the people of our nation and create a brilliant future.
